messages.content: can you make me a template document with markdown that will help guide people through note taking, a place to save prompts/observations that's a collective notes document?

Certainly! Here's a template document in Markdown format that can help guide people through note-taking and serve as a collective notes document:

```
# Notes Document

## Instructions

Welcome to the collective notes document! This document is designed to help you take organized notes and save prompts/observations in a collaborative manner. Please follow the guidelines below:

1. Create a new heading for each new topic or subject you want to take notes on.
2. Use bullet points or numbered lists to list key points, ideas, or observations under each heading.
3. Use subheadings within each section to further organize your notes.
4. Feel free to add any relevant links, images, or code snippets to enhance your notes.
5. If you have a prompt or observation to share, create a separate section for it and label it accordingly.

## Table of Contents

- [Topic 1](#topic-1)
- [Topic 2](#topic-2)
- [Topic 3](#topic-3)
- [Prompts and Observations](#prompts-and-observations)

## Topic 1

[Add your notes for Topic 1 here]

### Subtopic 1.1

[Add your notes for Subtopic 1.1 here]

### Subtopic 1.2

[Add your notes for Subtopic 1.2 here]

## Topic 2

[Add your notes for Topic 2 here]

### Subtopic 2.1

[Add your notes for Subtopic 2.1 here]

### Subtopic 2.2

[Add your notes for Subtopic 2.2 here]

## Topic 3

[Add your notes for Topic 3 here]

### Subtopic 3.1

[Add your notes for Subtopic 3.1 here]

### Subtopic 3.2

[Add your notes for Subtopic 3.2 here]

## Prompts and Observations

### Prompts

- Prompt 1: [Add your prompt here]
- Prompt 2: [Add your prompt here]
- Prompt 3: [Add your prompt here]

### Observations

- Observation 1: [Add your observation here]
- Observation 2: [Add your observation here]
- Observation 3: [Add your observation here]

```

Feel free to customize the template based on your specific requirements. Happy note-taking and collaboration!
share it like a google doc and no need to add all the subtopics

I apologize for the confusion. As an AI text-based model, I can't directly share a Google Doc. However, you can easily create a new Google Doc and copy-paste the template provided above into the document. From there, you can customize it further, add subtopics, and share it with others.

To create a new Google Doc:

1. Go to Google Drive (https://drive.google.com) and log in to your Google account.
2. Click the "+ New" button on the left-hand side of the screen.
3. Select "Google Docs" from the dropdown menu.
4. A new blank document will open. Copy the template from above and paste it into the new document.

Now you have a Google Doc with the template for note-taking. You can customize it to fit your needs, add subtopics, and share the document with others by clicking on the "Share" button in the top right corner of the Google Doc.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance!
what cna i paste into it

I apologize for the confusion. Here's a simplified version of the template that you can directly paste into a Google Doc:

```
# Notes Document

## Instructions

Welcome to the collective notes document! This document is designed to help you take organized notes and save prompts/observations in a collaborative manner. Please follow the guidelines below:

- Create a new heading for each new topic or subject you want to take notes on.
- Use bullet points or numbered lists to list key points, ideas, or observations under each heading.
- Feel free to add any relevant links, images, or code snippets to enhance your notes.
- If you have a prompt or observation to share, create a separate section for it and label it accordingly.

## Table of Contents

- [Topic 1](#topic-1)
- [Topic 2](#topic-2)
- [Prompts and Observations](#prompts-and-observations)

## Topic 1

[Add your notes for Topic 1 here]

## Topic 2

[Add your notes for Topic 2 here]

## Prompts and Observations

### Prompts

- Prompt 1: [Add your prompt here]
- Prompt 2: [Add your prompt here]
- Prompt 3: [Add your prompt here]

### Observations

```

Copy the above template and paste it into a new Google Doc. From there, you can start adding your notes, topics, prompts, and observations based on your specific needs. Remember to customize it further to suit your preferences.

Once you've pasted the template into a Google Doc, you can share the document with others by clicking on the "Share" button in the top right corner of the Google Doc.

I apologize for any inconvenience caused. If you have any further questions, feel free to ask!
